description: Long-term bullish reversal pattern shaped like a bowl or saucer. Represents gradual shift from bearish to bullish sentiment. More reliable than sharp reversals due to longer formation time.
validationRules: Smooth, rounded bottom with no sharp V-shape
Volume forms a U-shape (high at start, low in middle, increasing at end)
Pattern typically takes 3-6 months to form
Right side should mirror left side roughly
invalidationSignals: Sharp V-shaped bottom instead of gradual rounding
Price breaks below the lowest point of the pattern
Pattern completes too quickly (less than 1 month)
Irregular jagged price action instead of smooth curve
commonMistakes: Entering too early before pattern completes
Expecting exact symmetry between left and right sides
Confusing with cup and handle - rounding bottom has no handle
Not being patient - pattern takes months to form

tradeSetup.entry: Breakout above neckline or resistance with volume confirmation
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Below the lowest point of the rounding bottom
tradeSetup.target: Depth of pattern added to breakout point
tradeSetup.riskRewardRatio: Typically 2:1 to 4:1 due to long formation

supportive: RSI gradually rising from oversold to neutral/bullish
MACD crossover from negative to positive
conflicting: Volume increasing on left side (continued selling)
